title: Live tracking NFL cuts, trades and final roster moves around the league
content: We're following releases, trades, signings and other intriguing moves for all 32 NFL teams before the 4 p.m. ET roster cut-down deadline on Tuesday.

title: Browns trade QB Pickett to Raiders for '26 pick
content: The Raiders acquired Kenny Pickett from the Browns on Monday, giving them an experienced backup for Geno Smith after Aidan O'Connell was injured, and leaving Cleveland with rookies Dillon Gabriel and Shedeur Sanders behind starter Joe Flacco.

title: Raleigh joins Mantle in record books with 50th HR
content: Cal Raleigh hit his 50th homer, extending his major league record for a catcher and joining Mickey Mantle as the only switch-hitters to reach that mark.

title: Cards' Contreras ejected, hits own coach with bat
content: Following a called third strike in the seventh inning Monday, first baseman Willson Contreras threw a bat that mistakenly hit his own coach and tossed gum on the field after he was ejected in the St. Louis Cardinals' 7-6 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Bengals give star DE Hendrickson big pay bump
content: The Bengals and Trey Hendrickson reached agreement Monday on a $14 million raise for this year, boosting his 2025 salary to $30 million, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Veteran WR Cooper reunites with Raiders
content: Free agent wide receiver Amari Cooper is returning to the Raiders on a one-year contract, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: 'Dream come true': Clark a Nike signature athlete
content: Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark, the 2024 No. 1 WNBA draft pick, was introduced Monday as Nike's newest signature athlete, which entails the launch of a new signature logo, a collection of sportswear and apparel -- and eventually a signature sneaker.

title: Angels manager Washington had heart surgery
content: Angels manager Ron Washington said Monday he is recovering from quadruple bypass heart surgery and hopes to return to his position next season.

title: Venus shines in US Open return despite 3-set loss
content: Venus Williams, 45, played her first Grand Slam match in two years at the US Open on Monday, displaying some big serves and powerful groundstrokes before losing 6-3, 2-6, 6-1 to Karolina Muchova.

title: 💈Alcaraz's US Open haircut turns heads
content: When Alcaraz arrived at the US Open practice courts on Tuesday, his full head of hair was missing, replaced with a buzz cut.

title: Reranking every MLB farm system from 1 to 30
content: The busiest time of the year for adding prospects has passed. Here's how every organization stacks up now.

title: 'I can't go out like that': How Travis Kelce has prepared for what could be his final season

content: Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins and Hendrickson all landed new deals this offseason, and with that come expectations.

content: From Beyoncé to Mars, here's what people were talking about when Andy Roddick hoisted the trophy in 2003.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City plot move for United's Clinton

content: Abass Baraou and Yoenis Tellez put on a show during a slow boxing weekend. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: 5 killed, 14 injured in landslip on route to Vaishno Devi shrine

title: One-third school students take private coaching, trend more common in urban areas: Centre's survey
content: The average annual household expenditure on private coaching per student in urban areas (₹3,988) was higher than that in rural areas (₹1,793)

content: The clandestinely recorded clips included confidential judicial dictations and other official as well as unofficial conversations on different dates

title: Jarange firm on quota agitation in Mumbai from August 29; Government's attempt to dissuade him fails

title: Calcutta University, West Bengal government set for confrontation over exam date

title: Akhilesh meets Opposition V-P pick Sudershan Reddy, terms September 9 polls 'fight for justice'

content: Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee (TPCC) president B. Mahesh Kumar Goud and others joined the Yatra

title: Three students injured as government school window lintel collapses at Devanahalli near Bengaluru, plaint against Bharat Electronics Limited
content: The headmaster of the school has filed a complaint against the Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL), which constructed the building under a Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiative

title: Kannur jail smuggling racket: Youth admits to throwing ganja, mobiles inside for cash

title: Second round of CET-NEET counselling delayed: KEA to request extension of deadline for engineering admission in Karnataka

title: Never expected PM Modi to call us ‘thieves’, he should respect my chair as I do his, says Mamata Banerjee
content: The West Bengal CM called Mr. Modi’s comments as ‘insult’ to the people of West Bengal and lashed out for holding back central funds

title: China's Xi Jinping to welcome Vladimir Putin, PM Modi in grand show of solidarity

title: Bengaluru Metro security guard’s fall on tracks sparks concerns about long working hours and lack of safety barriers

title: Six registered political parties receive show-cause notices from Chennai district election office

title: Kerala Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan threatens to expose ‘shocking’ revelations involving CPI(M)

title: PM Modi visit to Japan: Quad an important forum for peace and stability in Indo-Pacific, says Vikram Misri

title: Karnataka Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar apologises for singing RSS anthem in Assembly

title: Cow has unique status, its slaughter can have repercussions on peace: Punjab and Haryana HC
content: Punjab and Haryana High Court dismisses anticipatory bail for Nuh resident accused of cow slaughter, citing cultural and legal implications

title: Vantara acknowledges Supreme Court order, says it will cooperate with SIT in fact-finding inquiry
content: The top court was hearing two PILs that made allegations of irregularities at Vantara relating to alleged non-compliance of laws and acquisition of animals from India and abroad, particularly elephants

title: After 350-km pursuit and dramatic chase, police nab two robbery suspects at Chennai Central station
content: In Jalakandapuram in Salem district, a 19-year-old migrant worker looted cash from a chicken shop supervisor’s pocket and ₹2 lakh from the shop by breaking open the lock, after a quarrel. He then fled the scene with his 30-year-old relative who worked at a nearby shop

title: Ruling MLAs create ruckus in Jharkhand Assembly over SIR, House adjourned twice
content: The members of the treasury bench then trooped into the Well, raising the slogan 'vote chor, gaddi chhod' (vote thief, renounce power).

title: UGC’s Learning Outcomes-based Curriculum Framework: What it proposes and why Kerala is pushing back | Explained
content: LDF government in Kerala has strongly objected to the proposed curriculum reforms, calling them a ploy to impose RSS’ Hindutva ideology under the guise of outcome-based education

title: Monsoon fury: Landslips, flash floods leave trail of destruction in Himachal Pradesh
content: The local meteorological office has issued a 'red' alert, warning of intense to very intense spells of rain at isolated places in Kangra, Chamba, and Lahaul and Spiti districts

title: SIT searches activist Mahesh Shetty Thimarody’s home in Dharmasthala case
content: Thimarody is currently out on bail after being arrested for allegedly making derogatory remarks against BJP's national general secretary (Organisation) B L Santhosh

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends Justice Shree Chandrashekhar as Bombay High Court Chief Justice
content: Collegium also approved the proposal for appointment of six additional judges as permanent judges in the Bombay High Court

title: Will consider implementing CM breakfast scheme in Punjab too, Bhagwant Mann tells Stalin
content: The Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann hails his Tamil Nadu counterpart Mr. Stalin as people’s leader

title: Ukraine counts on India’s contribution to ending war with Russia: Zelenskyy
content: “Now, as the entire world strives to end this horrible war with dignity and lasting peace, we count on India’s contribution,” Mr. Zelenskyy said

title: West Bengal colleges face admission crisis as student numbers plummet
content: Delayed centralised portal and legal disputes over OBC list leave many undergraduate seats vacant, with students increasingly choosing other States

title: ED’s ‘hospital construction scam’ searches in Delhi include former AAP Health Minister’s premises
content: It is alleged that there was large-scale corruption, unjustified cost escalations, unauthorised constructions, and misappropriation of funds in the health infrastructure projects of the then AAP-ruled Delhi government

title: U.S. gets ready to impose additional tariffs on India from August 27, issues official notification
content: “The duties set out in the Annex to this document are effective with respect to products of India that are entered for consumption, or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption, on or after 12:01 a.m. eastern daylight time on August 27, 2025,” the DHS notification said

title: Bhagwat to outline RSS’ vision for future India at 3-day lecture series from today
content: The lecture series, part of RSS’s outreach programme for its centenary year, is expected to be attended by around 1,300 people.

title: Presidential Reference hearing highlights: Several States argue against fixing timelines for President, Governors
content: Several States, mostly ruled by the BJP, argued in favour of the Presidential Reference and against fixing a time limit to higher Constitutional Authority.

title: Over 1,000 women entrepreneurs from SHGs to be trained in capacity building
content: The programme aims to cover 100 Mahila Shakti Canteens; the training will be focused on financial and digital literacy, sales, marketing and retail management

content: What has the World Health Organization said about Real Money Games? How are e-sports and social gaming segments different from online money games? What are the penalties laid out in the Act with respect to engaging with online money games? Has the Supreme Court intervened?

title: Traffic diversions for Khairatabad Bada Ganesh darshan
content: Congestion can be expected at Khairatabad, Shadan College, Nirankari, Old PS Saifabad, Mint Compound and Necklace Rotary from August 27 to September 6

title: Content creator Atharva Sudame deletes video on social harmony after backlash
content: Mr. Sudame’s reel evoked mixed responses on social media as some spoke in favour of it while some others opposed it strongly, telling him to not give any advice on religious matters

title: ‘One Family, One Entrepreneur’ scheme empowers 1,000 women to take the driver’s seat in A.P.
content: MEPMA joined hands with Rapido in March to provide electric two-wheelers and three-wheelers to SHG women and their families

title: IIT Bombay researchers use microbes to unlock nature’s hidden rules
content: Subtle changes in food lead to divergent evolutionary paths, offering clues to predict future adaptations

title: North Odisha faces flood situation due to incessant rain
content: A fresh low pressure area has formed over Bay of Bengal which will trigger rain till August 29, says IMD

title: Like bronze idols, India’s dino egg fossils risk being sold abroad
content: Around the world, fossils once bound for labs are now advertised in storefronts and auction houses. Ammonites, extinct sea creatures with coiled shells, once crowded ancient oceans. Today, their fossilised remains are sold on the streets of Paris. Larger, rarer specimens fetch staggering sums at auctions from private collectors

title: Police oppose Chennai conservancy workers’ plea to protest indefinitely
content: Say, the workers had lost a case against outsourcing of conservancy work and so they cannot indulge in protests instead of working out further legal remedy

title: Rajasthan High Court stays order on panchayat elections
content: A Single Judge Bench had on August 18 ordered the State government to conduct the panchayat polls soon, after which the State Election Commission stated that it would shortly announce the dates

title: Calcutta High Court directs CID to investigate unnatural deaths at Purba Medinipur’s Khejuri, notes differences in autopsies
content: After two persons were found dead at Muharram event site this year, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari had claimed that they were lynched for communal reasons, while the Trinamool Congress and the police maintained that the deaths were caused by an electrocution accident.

title: Supreme Court offers death row convict facility in jail to grieve virtually for his deceased mother
content: Bench rejects his plea to allow him to make the journey from a Surat jail to the “Naxalite” area of Buxar in Bihar to attend rituals

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar unveils projects worth ₹1056 crore for Patna Urban
content: The projects include ₹328.52 crore power modernisation and renovation of hostels of universities and colleges

title: Haryana Congress stages foot march against ‘vote theft’
content: Haryana Congress MLAs led by former Chief Minister and Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda held a foot march to stage their protest as they carried placards and raised slogans against the ECI and the BJP

title: Rameswaram, Kanniyakumari seen as potential destinations for cruise tourism in Tamil Nadu
content: Mr. Narwal said that they were in talks with the Andaman and Nicobar administration as well to explore the feasibility of cruise connectivity at various islands.

title: Technical, operational issues being resolved: SSC chief on ‘irregularities’ in recruitment exams
content: S. Gopalakrishnan says issues such as glitches in the computer-based tests and exams centres being far away from candidates’ residence are being resolved, and such disruptions are expected to be resolved from the upcoming Combined Graduate Level (CGL) examination

title: Tender minds being fed distorted history: Indian History Congress
content: IHC attacks NCERT's Partition modules, alleging that they spread “falsehoods with a clear communal intent”

title: Anamalai Tiger Reserve is home to 8 species of fireflies, finds study
content: The study was carried out by Advanced Institute for Wildlife Conservation, Vandalur, between April 2024 and March 2025. A. Udhayan, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests and Director of the institute, says this is the first study on fireflies in the State where genetic analysis was undertaken

title: Lack of diversity in Indian newsrooms a serious issue: N. Ram
content: Speaking at the inaugural of a residential workshop on journalism for students from rural, Scheduled Castes, and vulnerable communities, he says change will not happen by itself; it has to be enforced, and the State has to get involved

title: 4-Year-Old Boy's Face Bitten Off By Stray Dogs In Maharashtra
content: The flesh was coming off his face, his blue T-shirt was black in the middle with the blood having congealed. His eyes were open as he lay on the hospital bed. The four-year-old was attacked by a pack of dogs in Maharashtra.

title: Asia To Africa: Inside Putin's Plan To Export Russian Cyber Capabilities Worldwide
content: As the US and Europe tighten restrictions on Russian tech firms, Moscow is quietly extending its cyber influence across Africa, the Middle East, and Asia, presenting its commercial cybersecurity capabilities as protection against Western interference

title: University In Kerala Launches Dedicated Hostel For Transgender Students
content: For the first time in the state, a hostel exclusively to accommodate transgender students has been opened on the Mahatma Gandhi University campus in Kerala's Kottayam district.

title: "They Call Me President Of...": Trump Boasts As He Criminalises Burning US Flag
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday claimed that European leaders "jokingly" call him the "President of Europe", while speaking at the White House after he signed an Executive Order that makes burning the flag of America a criminal offence.

title: India Is Most Dangerous Country To Take Selfie, US Is Number 2
content: A new study might make you think twice before you grab your camera to take that Instagram-worthy selfie during a trip. With a startling 271 casualties-214 deaths and 57 injuries-India emerged as the deadliest country to take selfies.

title: Trump's Crackdown Gives Immigration Agency Power But Puts It Under Strain
content: Under President Donald Trump, the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency has become the driving force of his sweeping crackdown on migrants.

title: 4 Dead In Jammu, Vaishno Devi Yatra Stopped After Heavy Rain, Landslides
content: Four people have been killed, and several properties have been damaged due to heavy rain in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district. According to officials, two people died when their house collapsed, and two others died in flash floods

title: India Gets 2 New Frontline Warships: 10 Points On What Makes Them Special
content: Both warships are follow-on ships of the Project 17 ('Shivalik') class frigates and are largely indigenous, with over 75% of their components being made in India. They were built under Project 17A, or P17A, in which 'A' stands for Alpha.

title: "Smuggled Via Courier": How Hyderabad Busted University Drugs Racket
content: The anti-narcotics sleuths of Elite Action Group for Drug Law Enforcement (EAGLE) Telangana have busted one of the biggest university-linked drug rackets, uncovering the supply and sale of narcotics into educational campuses.

title: Bengal IPS Officer Awarded 3 Years After Daredevil Op Against Armed Robbers
content: Three years after he led a daredevil operation against a gang of robbers armed with sophisticated weapons and high-tech equipment, an IPS officer of West Bengal cadre received a gallantry award this Independence Day.

title: Indian-Origin Dubai Woman To Feature In Times Square Video On Down Syndrome
content: A 22-year-old Indian-origin woman from Dubai will be featured on the giant screens of New York's Times Square on September 6 as part of a global Down syndrome awareness campaign.

title: 4 Years Of This Ch***ya: US Political Scientist Uses Hindi Expletive For Trump
content: Carol Christine Fair is an American political scientist and associate professor at Georgetown University

title: Opinion: Opinion | Irony: 19 Dowry Deaths A Day, Yet 'Men's Rights' Groups Want Law Scrapped
content: On average, in 2020, more than 19 young women died every day due to dowry-related harassment. Every year, in the 2017-2022 period, an average of 7,000 cases of dowry deaths were reported across the country.

title: A Warning On Start-Up Valuations By Narayana Murthy-Owned Firm
content: The family office of tech billionaire Narayana Murthy is growing cautious on startups in India, pointing to steep discounts driven by funds that need to exit their investments.

title: Israeli Man Arrested For "Holocaust In Gaza" Graffiti At Jerusalem Church
content: An Israeli man was arrested on Tuesday on suspicion of spraying the words, "There is a Holocaust in Gaza", on one of the walls of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem's Old City, police said.

title: Flesh-Eating Screwworm Parasite Identified In A Person In Maryland
content: Screwworms were eradicated from the United States in the 1960s when researchers began releasing massive numbers of steriliSed male screwworm flies that mate with wild female screwworms to produce infertile eggs.

title: A Heart-Wrenching Image: 2 Children With Their Father's Body On Cart
content: A heart-wrenching image has emerged from Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj district, showing two children desperately seeking help on the streets with their father's body on a cart.

title: How Ajit Doval Outwitted A 'Spy Queen' And Secured Sikkim For India
content: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval's life has always read like a spy novel. One of his earliest and least-known missions played out not in Pakistan or China, but in the Himalayan kingdom of Sikkim.

title: 'Would Be Patriarchal Entitlement': Court Denies Man Bail For Wife's Murder
content: The Delhi High Court has held that a husband cannot justify violence against his wife on the ground of anger or refusal to live with him, stressing that such a claim reflects "patriarchal entitlement" which the law cannot support.

title: J&K flash floods: 5 killed as landslide hits Vaishno Devi shrine route; yatra suspended
content: Heavy monsoon rains triggered a landslide on the Mata Vaishno Devi shrine route in Jammu and Kashmir, injuring at least six. The yatra has been suspended, and trains to Katra cancelled. Widespread disruption continues across the region with landslides blocking the Jammu-Srinagar highway and cloudbursts causing flash floods in Doda.

title: 'If need arises, opening will be done by Navy': Chief of Naval Staff on Op Sindoor
content: Admiral Dinesh Kumar Tripathi affirmed the Indian Navy's readiness to act decisively, continuing Operation Sindoor if necessary. Speaking at the commissioning of INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri, he highlighted their role in deterring enemies and keeping Pakistan in check. Rajnath Singh commissioned the frigates, emphasizing their advanced capabilities for various missions and contribution to India's maritime security.

title: Videos, CCTV & conflicting claims: Noida's Nikki Bhati death case takes explosive turn
content: The Nikki Bhati murder case sees new developments. CCTV footage places Vipin, the husband, away from the house during the alleged attack. Police arrest Vipin's father and brother. Vipin claims a cylinder blast caused Nikki's injuries. Nikki's sister alleges Vipin set her on fire. Police are investigating dowry harassment and domestic violence angles. Vipin denies killing Nikki. The investigation continues.

title: Indian Navy milestone: Rajnath commissions stealth frigates INS Udaygiri and Himgiri
content: In a historic first, India's Navy commissioned two stealth frigates, INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri, built at separate shipyards, enhancing maritime capabilities. These Project 17A class warships, featuring advanced technology and significant indigenous content, signify a major boost to India's self-reliance in defence and commitment to maritime security in the Indian Ocean Region. The frigates will join the Eastern Fleet.

title: ‘Strategic shock’: Trump’s tariffs to hit 66% of India’s exports to US; China, Vietnam set to gain
content: Starting August 27, 2025, the US will impose 50% tariffs on $60.2 billion worth of Indian exports, impacting textiles, gems, and furniture. This move is projected to significantly reduce India's exports to the US, potentially benefiting countries like China and Vietnam.

title: Donald Trump gives ‘reminder’ to China while warning of more tariff
content: Donald Trump threatened China with 200% tariffs if rare-earth magnet exports are curbed, jeopardizing the trade truce. Trump claimed the U.S. leverage includes withholding Boeing parts, grounding Chinese planes. China's magnet exports to the U.S. surged recently. A Chinese analyst dismissed Trump's remarks as a bluff.

title: Rain fury in J&K: Roads washed away, flood alerts issued; 10 videos show havoc
content: Heavy rainfall in Jammu and Kashmir has triggered flash floods, cloudbursts, and landslides, resulting in three deaths and widespread damage. Rising river levels prompted alerts and evacuations, while landslides disrupted road connectivity. The meteorological department forecasts continued rainfall, warning of further potential disasters across the region.

title: Stunning prediction! Shreyas Iyer can captain India to a World Cup win'
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts a strong comeback for Shreyas Iyer. Iyer was ignored for the Asia Cup 2025 squad. Lobo believes Iyer's horoscope indicates a potential captaincy. He suggests Iyer could lead India to a major tournament victory, possibly a World Cup. Lobo warns selectors against overlooking Iyer's talent.

title: Google abandons virtual hiring model: CEO says AI cheating unstoppable
content: Google is reintroducing in-person job interviews as CEO Sundar Pichai addresses concerns about AI-driven cheating during virtual hiring. This decision marks a shift from the remote practices adopted during the pandemic. Employees raised the issue, prompting Google to balance efficiency with the need to ensure the authenticity of the hiring process, acknowledging that competitors face similar challenges.

title: 'Is it time to pause H-1B?' asks US Senator: Ticking clock for Indian students
content: The H-1B visa program, crucial for Indian students and professionals in the US, faces increased scrutiny due to unverified allegations of kickbacks for hiring Indian tech workers. Political figures are questioning the program's future, potentially disrupting the study-to-work pipeline and impacting the Indian IT workforce. This debate is fueled by broader concerns about American jobs and geopolitical tensions.

title: 'Tried to pull BJP's leg': DKS 'apologises' after RSS anthem row; backs Gandhi family
content: DK Shivakumar apologized on Tuesday for reciting the RSS anthem in the Karnataka Assembly, sparking controversy. Khan stated his remarks were intended to tease the BJP and expressed regret if anyone was hurt.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara retires: How much pension will he earn each month?
content: Cheteshwar Pujara, the former Indian Test cricket legend, has retired from international cricket after an illustrious career spanning 103 Test matches. He accumulated 7,195 runs and played a pivotal role in India's batting lineup. The BCCI will provide Pujara with a monthly pension, acknowledging his significant contributions to Indian cricket.

title: SpaceX prodigy exits: Kairan Quazi, hired by Elon Musk at 14, says ‘I felt ready’
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old former SpaceX engineer, is making a surprising move to Wall Street, joining Citadel Securities as a quantitative developer. He chose quant finance over AI labs due to its fast-paced environment and immediate impact. Quazi's unconventional path includes skipping grades and becoming SpaceX's youngest employee, now he's ready to tackle new challenges in the financial world.

title: One ball, two sixes, 13 runs! Sanju Samson does the unthinkable ahead of Asia Cup - Watch
content: Sanju Samson's explosive form in the Kerala Cricket League, including a rare achievement of 13 runs in a delivery, has reignited debate about his inclusion in India's Asia Cup squad. The wicketkeeper-batter smashed 89 off 46 balls, continuing his impressive run. While Ajinkya Rahane supports Samson's inclusion, other pundits believes Shubman Gill's return seals his fate, likely keeping him out of the playing XI.

title: 'Didn't expect him to call us thieves': Mamata hits back at PM Modi
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's remarks labeling her party, TMC, as "thieves." Banerjee defended her government's performance, asserting that the state has properly utilized central funds and responded to all queries.

title: Trump’s 50% tariffs: India signals no plans to stop Russia oil trade
content: Indian refiners plan to slightly decrease Russian crude oil imports in the coming weeks. While maintaining energy ties with Moscow, projected purchases will fall from 1.8 million barrels per day to between 1.4 and 1.6 million. The US has criticized India's increased reliance on Russian oil.

title: After blasting Gambhir, ex-India player slams Dhoni - 'He did not like me'
content: Manoj Tiwary has accused MS Dhoni of favoritism, claiming he wasn't backed despite strong performances, including a century. Tiwary suggests Dhoni's preferences influenced team selection, preventing him from securing a consistent place in the playing XI. He expressed his confusion and disappointment, highlighting a perceived lack of support during Dhoni's captaincy.

title: Greater Noida dowry murder: Father of Nikki makes shocking 'signboard' claim
content: Nikki Bhati's father is demanding the demolition of her in-laws' house after she was allegedly murdered for dowry in Greater Noida. He accuses the family of relentless harassment and obstructing her business aspirations, alleging his daughter was set ablaze after dowry demands went unmet. Police have arrested the husband and in-laws, while the NCW condemns the killing.

title: 'Missions to be conducted': PM Modi addresses India's rare earths shortages
content: Prime Minister Modi launched the National Critical Mineral Mission to boost domestic exploration and capacity for rare earth minerals vital for the auto industry. He flagged off Maruti Suzuki’s first BEV, the e-Vitara, for export to 100 countries, highlighting India's growing role in global EV manufacturing.

title: Record! 102-year-old, with heart condition, becomes oldest to climb Mount Fuji
content: Kokichi Akuzawa, a 102-year-old Japanese man with a heart condition, has set a Guinness World Record as the oldest person to climb Mount Fuji. Despite facing health challenges and an earlier fall, he trained rigorously with weekly mountain hikes. Akuzawa completed the ascent over three days, supported by his family, but has no plans to climb again.

title: Fake NRI admissions racket in medical education: The new red lines
content: A massive fake NRI-quota admissions scam exposed by the Enforcement Directorate has revealed how fabricated guardians, forged certificates, and counterfeit notary stamps were used to secure nearly 18,000 medical seats in West Bengal and Odisha. In response, authorities have enforced stricter rules—tightening guardianship definitions, disallowing extended family sponsorship, mandating embassy-issued certificates, and limiting validity to one year to prevent misuse.

title: 'I don't want to be defense only': Trump's new 'department of war' idea
content: President Trump has expressed interest in renaming the Department of Defense to the Department of War, believing the latter conveys a stronger image of American military power. He has criticized the term "Defense" as sounding weak and suggested the change reflects a rejection of political correctness. However, such a change would require congressional approval, given the department's legal foundation.

title: Boney Kapoor moves Madras HC; alleges 3 individuals illegally claiming Sridevi’s property
content: Boney Kapoor has approached the Madras High Court, contesting claims to a Chennai property once owned by his late wife, Sridevi. Kapoor alleges that three individuals are unlawfully asserting ownership, potentially through fraudulent means. He disputes the validity of their claims, particularly questioning a legal heirship certificate issued to them.

title: Sarfaraz Khan on fire! Sends strong message to selectors ahead of Windies Tests
content: Sarfaraz Khan's unbeaten 109 propelled Mumbai against Haryana in the Buchi Babu Tournament, rescuing them from an early collapse. This century follows his earlier 138 against TNCA XI, solidifying his form ahead of the Test season.

title: Happy Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes, greetings and images
content: Ganesh Chaturthi, a major Indian festival, will be celebrated on August 26, 2025. This ten-day festival honors the birth of Lord Ganesha. Devotees will worship idols at home and in public. Lord Ganesha is the god of wisdom, prosperity, and fortune. The festival includes messages, wishes and quotes. People will celebrate with devotion and joy with friends and family.  Read below!

title: Heavy rains lash J&K: Landslides reported at multiple locations; Srinagar highway closed
content: A cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district triggered flash floods, disrupting normal life and closing the Jammu-Srinagar highway. Heavy rainfall caused landslides at multiple locations, halting traffic and damaging homes in Kishtwar, Doda, and Rajouri. Rivers are overflowing, and authorities have issued warnings for continued rainfall and potential hazards.

title: 'He's a hypocrite' - Former India cricketer lambasts Gautam Gambhir - Here's why
content: Former Indian cricketer Manoj Tiwary has strongly criticized head coach Gautam Gambhir, labeling him a "hypocrite" for India's upcoming Asia Cup match against Pakistan. Tiwary highlighted Gambhir's previous stance against playing Pakistan, questioning his current role as coach.

title: Traders bathe in potholes to protest crumbling road in Chhattisgarh - watch
content: Traders in Chhattisgarh's Korba district staged a half-naked protest, bathing in pothole-filled rainwater on the Kusmunda–Imlichapar road to highlight its appalling condition. The monsoon has transformed the road into a hazardous pond, severely disrupting business and causing frequent accidents. Frustrated by government inaction, the traders took this symbolic step to demand immediate repairs.

title: Asia Cup | SKY on his injury status - 'I knew how the recovery is going to be'
content: Suryakumar Yadav recovered from an injury sustained near the end of IPL 2025. He spent weeks at the BCCI Centre of Excellence. There, he underwent a structured rehabilitation process. Yadav praised the facility and staff for their support. He focused on mindset and physical recovery. Now, Suryakumar Yadav is fit.

title: 'Inshallah...': Pakistan bowler warns India ahead of Asia Cup clash in UAE - Watch
content: Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf has stirred the pot ahead of the Asia Cup clash with India, confidently proclaiming victory in both anticipated matches. While Pakistan gears up for the tournament and a preceding tri-series, a surprising squad selection sees Salman Agha appointed captain, with Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan notably absent.

title: 'Obstacles to free trade': German official backs India on Trump tariffs; calls for slashing duties
content: German envoy Georg Enzweiler criticized the US imposition of tariffs on various countries, deeming them "obstacles to free trade." He advocated for minimizing tariffs to promote open commerce.

title: Trump tariff impact: Why is stock market down today? Top 6 reasons
content: Donald Trump tariffs impact on stock market: Indian stock markets plummeted on Tuesday, with the Nifty50 and Sensex taking a hit following the US imposing 50% tariffs on Indian exports. This decision, coupled with profit booking, foreign investment outflows, and a weakening rupee, intensified negative market sentiment.

title: Trump's tariff bomb on India: US issues notice to implement 50% 'sanctions'
content: The US has imposed a 50% tariff on most goods imported from India, citing India's indirect import of Russian oil and alleged threats to the US. This action, impacting sectors like textiles and seafood, exempts pharmaceuticals and electronics. Analysts predict a potential GDP reduction for India, although the impact is moderated by domestic consumption.

title: Syko Stu GoFundMe fundraiser crosses $50,000 following Raja Jackson wrestling attack
content: Pro wrestler Syko Stu, a U.S. Army veteran, is hospitalized after a violent, unscripted attack by Raja Jackson, son of UFC star Quinton “Rampage” Jackson, at a KnokX Pro Wrestling event in Sun Valley, California. Stu's wife, Contessa Patterson, launched a GoFundMe page to support his treatment and recovery, which has already raised over $50,000.

title: Alien spaceship or comet? NASA shares update on object racing through Solar System
content: NASA's telescopes have captured detailed observations of interstellar object 3I/ATLAS, confirming it as a natural comet rich in CO₂ and water ice. Discovered in 2025, the comet's composition and trajectory align with known processes of icy comets ejected from other star systems, debunking speculation about alien origins. Ongoing observations aim to understand its structure and activity.

title: ‘Not beautiful enough’: MP bride tortured, branded with hot knife; over 50 burn marks found
content: In a shocking incident in Barwani district, a man branded his wife with a hot knife, accusing her of not being beautiful. Khushboo, the victim, reported the abuse to the police, revealing over 50 burn marks on her body. Her husband, Dilip Pipaliya, has been booked for causing hurt and cruelty.

title: Big Make-in-India push: PM Modi inaugurates EV plant in Gujarat
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated Maruti Suzuki's first made-in-India Battery Electric Vehicle, the e-Vitara, in Gujarat, destined for export to over 100 countries. This launch, coinciding with the start of hybrid battery electrode production, signifies India's growing strength in green mobility.

title: ‘Caught on camera’: Video shows Israeli strike on Nasser Hospital; journalists among 20 killed
content: Israeli strikes on Gaza's Nasser Hospital in Khan Yunis resulted in the deaths of at least 20 people, including five journalists. The initial strike hit the hospital's fourth floor, a common location for reporters, followed by a second explosion targeting medics and journalists assisting the wounded.

title: Vehicle falls into river ahead of Kiren Rijiju’s convoy in Ladakh; 2 men rescued
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju's convoy was near Drass in Ladakh when a vehicle plunged into a river, prompting a rescue of two individuals. Rijiju also lauded Sonmarg's hospitality and development in Jammu and Kashmir. Furthermore, he criticized Syeda Hameed's remarks on Bangladeshi immigrants, emphasizing concerns about illegal migration and the persecution of minorities in neighboring countries.

title: Anu Malik reacts to his relationship with nephews Amaal & Armaan; calls them his ‘jaan’
content: Anu Malik clarified his strong bond with brothers Daboo and Abu Malik, dismissing rumors of family tensions and emphasizing their enduring love. He acknowledged their 'Malik trait' of expressing affection through what others perceive as anger. Amaal Mallik previously revealed the brothers' professional rivalry, where Anu's competitive nature sometimes impacted Daboo's career, despite their close personal relationship.

title: Kerala temple row: Purification ritual at Guruvayoor; reels in pond trigger complaint
content: Guruvayur devaswom has ordered purification rituals at the temple after vlogger Jasmin Jaffar allegedly washed her feet in the temple pond and filmed reels, violating temple rules. The rituals, scheduled for Tuesday, will lead to restricted entry for devotees. Devaswom administrator filed a police complaint and will initially cover ritual expenses from devaswom funds, later pursuing legal action.

title: Mysuru lodge murder: Man kills lover with ‘controlled blast in her mouth’; face blown up
content: A 25-year-old man, Siddaraju, has been detained in Mysuru district for the murder of 20-year-old Darshitha in a lodge room. Police suspect Siddaraju, who knew Darshitha for seven years, killed her after she refused to marry him.

title: Nasa to launch TOMEX+ mission from Wallops Island
content: NASA is preparing to launch three sounding rockets from Wallops Island, Virginia, on August 26, 2025, as part of the TOMEX+ mission. Residents across the mid-Atlantic may witness colourful vapour trails. The mission will study the mesopause, a critical atmospheric layer influencing weather and satellite operations.

title: Himachal flood: Beas river washes away parts of Chandigarh highway; Manali-Leh road blocked
content: Heavy flooding of the Beas river has caused significant damage, washing away sections of the Chandigarh-Manali highway and impacting hotels and restaurants. Key routes like the Manali-Leh highway are blocked due to the river's force. With a red alert issued, educational institutions across several districts including Kullu and Mandi, remain closed as the region grapples with the aftermath.

title: Which WNBA teams have clinched a spot in the 2025 playoffs?
content: eight teams advance to the 2025 WNBA playoffs, and the bracket is filling up . the regular season wraps up Sept. 11, and we're tracking which teams have secured a spot in the postseason, which opens Sept. 14 .

title: 'Transitions take time': How things are different for Kalen DeBoer in Year 2 at Alabama
content: "it was basically the elephant in the room," says a team meeting . "if you don't want to be here, leave," says the team's head strength coach . a meeting in which coach David Ballou spared nobody in an earsplitting tirade .

title: Why Washington's offense is the big winner in Terry McLaurin's new deal
content: new: a former assistant coach says the deal needed to get done . new: the real money on the new deal won't be known until the three-year deal . the deal is expected to be announced on monday . it's unclear who won the contract extension .

title: Is Gladbach the place to boost Reyna's career?
content: the 22-year-old is in desperate need of a fresh start . he is plagued by injuries and inconsistency in the past four seasons . the american earned just 342 minutes in the previous Bundesliga season .

title: College Football Playoff 2025: G5 contenders lead preseason bubble watch
content: boise state have the highest chance to reach the playoff (25%) of any G5 team . coach Spencer Danielson met with his players and reminded them that in 2024 they weren't ranked at all . "there's an edge you have to have in life," says Danielson .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as a one-stop shop for all of our best material as you prepare to make the best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot at a championship.
